EXTRACTED VALUE: Lakers big man Josh Powell could be thrust into action if Andrew Bynum is limited by his knee injury on Sunday.
Austin Daye got another DNP-CD on Tuesday, as the Pistons fell by the score of 88-84 against the Mavs.
The Jazz are said to be working out point guard Earl Watson, who played for the Pacers last season.
Matt Bonner returned from a back injury but missed all six of his shots, failing to score in 17 minutes.
The Pacers are said to be trying to move Dahntay Jones and Solomon Jones in a two-for-one deal in an effort to get their roster down to 15 players.
Back up center Sean Marks left Friday's game with a sprained ankle after scoring six points.
Rodney Carney ran with the first team at shooting guard in practice Tuesday.
Magic guard J.J. Redick (stomach virus) is 50-50 at best for Friday's game.
Gerald Wallace (elbow) practiced Tuesday and said he will play against the Hornets Wednesday.
D.J. White assigned D.J. White to the D-League on Wednesday.
DeJuan Blair had nine points, 11 rebounds, and two steals on Sunday, as the Spurs defeated the Thunder in Oklahoma City.
Tony Battie (knee) will make his first preseason appearance of the season Tuesday night.
Jermaine O'Neal (knee) is hoping to resume working out next week.
Steve Blake (stomach virus) will not play for the Lakers on Sunday.
Jon Brockman (sprained left ankle) will miss the Bucks' next three preseason games.
Shannon Brown had 11 points and a 3-pointer in just 17 minutes on Friday after suffering an eye injury.
